headline: Chocolate Martini
description: This ultra-chocolatey martini is what dessert cocktail dreams are made of.
recipeIngredient: 3 tablespoons chocolate syrup, preferably dark, plus more for drizzling
4 ounces chocolate liqueur, such as Godvia

recipeInstructions.name: Step 1
recipeInstructions.text: Place 2 martini glasses in the freezer for at least 15 minutes.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 2
recipeInstructions.text: Drizzle 1 tablespoon of the chocolate syrup on a small shallow plate; dip the rims of the frozen martini glasses in the chocolate syrup. Drizzle the remaining 2 tablespoons chocolate syrup inside the glasses in a zigzag pattern. The glasses can be used immediately or frozen until ready to drink.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 3
recipeInstructions.text: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice, then add 5 ounces vanilla vodka, 4 ounces chocolate liqueur, and 3 ounces Baileys. Cover and shake vigorously until well-chilled and the outside of the shaker is frosty, about 15 seconds.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 4
recipeInstructions.text: Strain into the prepared glasses. Use a vegetable peeler to shave dark chocolate over each drink.

HowtoTip.text: Make ahead: Prepare the martini mixture up to 5 days in advance and refrigerate an airtight container. Shake with ice before serving. To serve a crowd: You can scale up the recipe and mix ingredients in a pitcher. Shake in small batches as needed.

author.name: Laura Rege
author.description: Laura Rege is a recipe developer and food stylist living the mid-coastal lifestyle between Dallas and Brooklyn. Formerly a senior member of the editorial teams at Food & Wine and Martha Stewart Living, Laura now creates and styles recipes for websites like ours and cooking videos! When she's not in the kitchen for work, she is off traveling in the U.S. or abroad searching out the next delicious bite.
